areaDescription: As a recent graduate, I don't have much work experience to showcase.

fullDescription.Text-1: I worked voluntarily for Associate Professor Nguyen Tien Huy as a team leader and data analyst.
fullDescription.Text-2: My work included leading teams to organize systematic reviews and meta-analyses.
fullDescription.Text-3: I gained extensive teamwork and communication abilities, as well as leadership and management skills.
fullDescription.Text-4: I  was also an experienced data analyst, handling multiple analyses for the group and providing analytical strategies for some teams.
fullDescription.Text-5: This experience gave me valuable statistical skills and basic coding experience in R.
fullDescription.Text-6: I got 9 publications in Medicine, with 2 as the first author.

educationHistory.title: Publications
educationHistory.shortDescription: All of my publications are from ORC.

Publication-1.title: The prevalence of Pfk13 polymorphism in malaria patients treated with artemisinin-based therapy: a systematic review and meta-analysis.

Publication-2.title: The efficacy and adverse effects of favipiravir on patients with COVID-19: A systematic review and meta-analysis of published clinical trials and observational studies.

Publication-3.title: Compound K: A systematic review of its anticancer properties and probable mechanisms.

Publication-4.title: Effectiveness of perindopril/amlodipine fixed-dose combination in the treatment of hypertension: a systematic review.

Publication-5.title: Efficacy of Kinesio Taping Compared to Other Treatment Modalities in Musculoskeletal Disorders: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis.

Publication-6.title: Factors associated with successful publication for systematic review protocol registration: an analysis of 397 registered protocols.

Publication-7.title: A Review of the In Vitro Inhibition of α-Amylase and α-Glucosidase by Chalcone Derivatives.

Publication-8.title: The role of nursing leadership in promoting evidence-based nursing practice.

Publication-9.title: Exchange transfusion in the management of critical pertussis in young infants: a case series.
